resources.string: LG Optimus G (geehrc, geeb), Google Nexus 4 (mako)
No need, development settings are enabled by default.
Double-tap navigation bar to put the device to sleep
Kill the foreground app by long-pressing the back key
Pressing the volume keys will wake your device
Wake up device if charger is plugged/unplugged.
Double-tap status bar to put the device to sleep
Press on color below to apply
%1$s edge of the status bar pulls down Quick Settings
When screen off, long-pressing the volume rockers will seek music tracks
Volume rocker wake must be disabled
Hide the traffic monitor when there is no activity
Hide the traffic monitor activity arrows
Show the weather in the status bar header
View or change how the \'cLock\' widget will display
Choose an icon for displaying the weather condition
Choose when the weather panel should be hidden
The weather panel will be hidden when the visible notifications will reach the maximum allowed notifications on the lock screen
The weather panel will be hidden when the visible notifications will reach the chosen number of notifications
The weather panel won\`t be hidden
Must be in DateFormat eg. MM/dd/yy
Show a brightness slider in the quick settings panel
The value must be between %1$d and %2$d DPI
Open Quick Settings when there are %1$s notifications present
Enable orange status - navigation bars when battery saver is activated
Two main tiles on the first row
Available only for apps that support expanded notifications
This will hide all Immersive Mode Messages
This will hide all force close notificaitons
Enable search bar in recents menu
Enable/disable the search bar in the recents menu
Reset all dimensions entries to default?
Place the navigation bar on the left side of the screen in landscape mode
Display left and right cursor buttons for IME.
Edit and rearrange navigation bar buttons

To get started tap the edit icon to unlock the navigation bar for editing.

You can tap an icon to change its shortcut, or long press an icon to re-arrange the layout.

Tap save to commit your changes, or restore to reset the layout to default settings.
Delete current settings and restore the default layout?
Allow notification lights in do not disturb mode
Display the number of pending notifications
Scramble PIN layout when unlocking device
Unlock automatically when the correct PIN/password is entered
Include foreground task when clearing all
Phone information, usage statistics, wifi information
Scrolling cache may improve scrolling performance at the cost of memory
Enable TCP/IP debugging over network interfaces (Wi-Fi, USB networks). This setting is reset on reboot

WARNING: When ADB over network is enabled, your phone is open for intrusions on all connected networks, including GSM data network!

Only use this feature when you are connected on trusted networks.

Do you really want to enable this function?
Display a notification when USB debugging is connected
Battery history stats are going to be reset
Volume keys control media volume rather than notifications
Please enter a new label. Leave blank to revert to stock label.
Change the view of the recents screen
Enable media cover art on the lockscreen
Show circle app launcher after touching right side of screen
Apps will show in app circle bar
Adjust the width of the trigger area
Adjust the vertical postion of the trigger area
Adjust the height of the trigger area
Show notification as heads up from these applications
To add a custom per-app configuration for expanded state, set "Enabled for all" to the off position
Choose a default expanded desktop style
Blurs and displays the content behind your lockscreen
For better visibility on bright images
Bug reporting is disabled in development settings
You don\'t have any blocked numbers. Add an entry by touching the Add (+) button.
To prevent phone numbers from calling or messaging you, enable the blocked caller list.
You will not receive incoming calls or messages from phone numbers on the blocked caller list
Don\'t block calls from private numbers
Don\'t block calls or messages from numbers not in the contact list
Block incoming %s from numbers not in the contact list
Use . as a wildcard and * for repetition. E.g. 123.* blocks numbers starting with 123 and .*123.* blocks numbers containing 123
Unable to add invalid phone number to blocked caller list
Do you want to remove this blocked phone number?
Control apps permissions with more power
Adjust the vibration when double tapping the power button
Double tap on the power button to launch right lockscreen target
Change the default font of the lockscreen clock widget
Screen overlay showing current CPU info
Longpress power button with screen of turns on torch
Show battery saver notification when enabled
Show low battery notification when enabled
Adjust the rocker orientation based on current rotation
Controls the quick settings edit icon in the drawer
Double tap on the top third or bottom shortcut area of the lock screen to put the device to sleep
Enable MTP instead charging after connect to PC
Landscape keyboard will never take up entire screen
The charging animation may result in a poor user experience. Enable at your own discretion.
Swiping up on the heads up notification will snooze heads up from that application for %d minutes
Allow override of default values with user config
Pulse will be triggered by pick up sensor
Pick up sensor will not be utilized as a trigger
Pulse will be triggered by notifications
Notifications will not be utilized as a trigger
Enable application management shortcuts in notification area and recent apps list
Show notifications from this app on the lockscreen
Never show persistent notifications from this app on the lockscreen
Open app in floating window when peeking notification is tapped
Show a brightness icon to the left of the brighness slider to adjust auto-brightness
Allow apps to bypass security systems by pretending to be a different app
Allowing apps to bypass security systems can lead to serious security and privacy problems! Check that only benign apps use the corresponding permission when this is active.
